what: throws error if the number of requested CPUs exceeds the number of CPUs available in the requested partition — check_slurm_partitions
title: throws error if the number of requested CPUs exceeds the number of CPUs available in the requested partition — check_slurm_partitions
text: throws error number requested CPUs exceeds number CPUs available requested partition

title: throws error if the number of requested CPUs exceeds the number of CPUs available in the requested partition — check_slurm_partitions
throws error if the number of requested CPUs exceeds the number of CPUs available in the requested partition — check_slurm_partitions
text: ncpu number CPUs requested user partition name partition requested user cache optional argument forgo caching

title: throws error if the number of requested CPUs exceeds the number of CPUs available in the requested partition — check_slurm_partitions
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ check_slurm_partitions(17, "cpu2mem4gb") check_slurm_partitions(3, "cpu2mem4gb") check_slurm_partitions(5, "cpu4mem32gb") check_slurm_partitions(5, "cpu4mem32gb") check_slurm_partitions(100, "cpu32mem128gb") check_slurm_partitions(2, "cpu2mem4gb") } # }

what: Creates a default watcher configuration file — generate_watcher_config
title: Creates a default watcher configuration file — generate_watcher_config
text: Creates default watcher configuration file

title: Creates a default watcher configuration file — generate_watcher_config
code: generate_watcher_config(   .mod,   model_number = "",   files_to_track = c("lst", "ext", "grd"),   tmp_dir = "/tmp",   watched_dir = file.path("model", "nonmem"),   output_dir = file.path(watched_dir, "in_progress"),   poll_duration = 1,   alert = "None",   level = "Debug",   email = "",   threads = 1 )

title: Creates a default watcher configuration file — generate_watcher_config
text: .mod bbi nonmem model object model_number string model number e.g. 101a15. Default pulled .mod files_to_track vector file extensions. Default c("lst", "ext", "grd") tmp_dir temporary directory location run nonmem. Default /tmp watched_dir directory nonmem output. Default ./model/nonmem output_dir directory watcher place log output files default ./model/nonmem/in_progress poll_duration amount time seconds watchers polling alert send alerts . Default None, available options None Slack level level log . Default info. Available options Trace, Debug, Info, Warn, Fatal email alert set Slack, email associated slack get messages sent directly . threads number threads running parallel job. Default 1

title: Creates a default watcher configuration file — generate_watcher_config
text: none

title: get partition suggestions — partition_advice
text: call submit_slurm_model(), number requested CPUs exceeds number CPUs available requested partition, check_slurm_partitions() errors.  function follows message providing one two suggestions partition smallest sufficient number CPUs least amount memory.  partitions enough CPUs accommodate number requested, function's return message clarifies .

title: Generates a tidyverse-esque onAttach message — slurmtools_options_message
Generates a tidyverse-esque onAttach message — slurmtools_options_message
text: message display attach

title: Generates a tidyverse-esque onAttach message — slurmtools_options_message
code:
slurmtools_options_message() #> [1] "── \033[1mNeeded slurmtools options\033[22m ───────────────────────────────────────────────────
\033[31m✖\033[39m option('slurmtools.slurm_job_template_path') is not set.
\033[31m✖\033[39m option('slurmtools.submission_root') is not set.
\033[36mℹ\033[39m Please set all options for job submission defaults to work."

what: submit a nonmem model to slurm in parallel — submit_nonmem_model
title: submit a nonmem model to slurm in parallel — submit_nonmem_model
text: submit nonmem model slurm parallel

title: submit a nonmem model to slurm in parallel — submit_nonmem_model
code: submit_nonmem_model(   .mod,   partition = get_slurm_partitions(),   ncpu = 1,   overwrite = FALSE,   dry_run = FALSE,   ...,   slurm_job_template_path = getOption("slurmtools.slurm_job_template_path"),   submission_root = getOption("slurmtools.submission_root"),   slurm_template_opts = list() )

title: submit a nonmem model to slurm in parallel — submit_nonmem_model
text: .mod path model bbi nonmem model object partition name partition submit model ncpu number cpus run model overwrite whether overwrite existing model results dry_run return command invoked, without invoking ... arguments pass processx::run slurm_job_template_path path slurm job template submission_root directory track job submission scripts output slurm_template_opts choose slurm template
